page.title: 12 Castle Farm
page.content: Mr. Berridge lives at Castle Farm with his wife and two sons Michael and Richard. Mr. Berridge was born in the present farm house. He grows mostly oil seed rape (used for cooking oil and margarine), barley (used for beer, gin and ale) and the wheat (for biscuits and bread). He came to work the farm after his father died 10 years ago. At the moment the crops are tall and green and will soon be ready for harvesting. After harvesting he will put the corn in the barn with big fans that blow the corn dry. He has a big pond full of trout in the garden in front of the house, and when we fed them they jumped and dived after the food (small brown pellets). He has a special room for his fishing gear and on the table was the skull of a pike.
